intro: Leptalix retusa, commonly known as the slender lexicostemon, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color, arranged in whorls along the stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique botanical appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Leptalix retusa is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
